name: ariana
description: Debug your JS/TS/Python code effortlessly just by hovering it, or by asking AI.

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Ariana
walkthroughs.description: Discover how Ariana can help you debug your code effortlessly with AI

steps.title: Welcome to Ariana
steps.description:
Ariana helps you understand your JS, TS and Python code by showing expression values and execution times without traditional debuggers or print statements.

This walkthrough will guide you through setting up and using Ariana for the first time.

steps.title: Install the Ariana CLI
steps.description:
Before using the extension, you need to install the Ariana CLI globally:

**For JavaScript/TypeScript:**
```bash
npm install -g ariana
```

**For Python:**
```bash
pip install ariana
```

[Open Terminal](command:workbench.action.terminal.new)

steps.title: Run Your Code with Ariana
steps.description:
Run your code as you normally would, but prefix the command with `ariana`:

**JavaScript/TypeScript:**
```bash
ariana npm run dev
```

**Python:**
```bash
ariana python myscript.py
```

This will generate execution traces that the extension can use.

media.altText: Terminal showing Ariana CLI in action

steps.title: Enable Expression Highlighting
steps.description:
After running your code with Ariana, enable expression highlighting in VS Code to see which code was executed and inspect values:

[Enable Highlighting](command:ariana.toggleHighlighting)

steps.title: Inspect Expression Values
steps.description:
Hover over any highlighted expression to see:
- The last value it took during execution
- How long it took to run
- How many times it was evaluated

This gives you immediate insight into your code's behavior without having to add print statements.

media.altText: Hovering over code to see values

steps.title: Get AI Insights (Experimental)
steps.description:
After running your code with Ariana, you can ask AI to recap what happened or identify root causes of errors:

```bash
ariana --recap
```

This can help you understand complex execution flows or troubleshoot issues faster.

[Open Terminal](command:workbench.action.terminal.new)
